availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Feland (Christian County, Kentucky, lawyer and quarter master 8th Ky Cavalry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Christian, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel and Nancy Feland. Married to Sarah Kennedy Feland on February 12, 1863 in Todd County, Kentucky. Father of William Feland. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky in 1850. Lawyer in Christian County, Kentucky in 1860. Served as quartermaster in 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) from December 31, 1861 to June 24, 1862. Served as quartermaster and second lieutenant in 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from September 8, 1862 to his resignation March 24, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0028 and 0089.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian, District 2, p. 427B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian, p. 508.
Find A Grave, "John Feland (1837-1899)," Memorial #88564012, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88564012 (accessed July 10, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186.
